roleset.name: transfer of goods, acquire
roleset.note: GET-V NOTES: Based on big corpus. Member of VNcls get-13.5.1-1. (from get.01-v)

example.name: get-v: simple transitive
example.text: Could I get a one-way ticket from Milwaukee to Orlando?
example.arg: a one-way ticket from Milwaukee to Orlando

example.name: get-v: with price
example.text: They get something equally good for less.

example.name: get-v: with source
example.text: The march got its support from self-serving groups.

example.name: get-v: with benefactive
example.text: John got some flowers for his mother.

example.name: get-v: price as subject
example.text: $15 gets you a lot of daisies.

roleset.name: have-got: already possess
roleset.note: GET-V NOTES: No VNcls. (from get.02-v)

example.name: always with have auxiliary?
example.text: You've got two champions sitting right before you.
example.arg: two champions sitting right before you

roleset.name: become
roleset.note: GET-V NOTES: Member of VNcls convert-26.6.2. (from get.03-v)

roles.note: If the rel is followed by a VP node, it's really an auxilliary-- which is roleset get.24! (from get.03-v)

role.descr: attribute of arg1 (not a VP node)

example.name: basic becoming
example.text: That got hard to take.

example.name: it support
example.text: It's getting harder *trace* to sell.

roleset.name: cause to do or be something
roleset.note: GET-V NOTES: Member of VNcls convert-26.6.2. (from get.04-v)

role.descr: a clause -- action done or descriptive small clause

example.name: become with agent
example.text: They got us thinking, "maybe we could be doing PAS tagging!"
example.arg: us thinking, "maybe we could be doing PAS tagging!"

example.name: cause
example.text: They get big studios to bankroll and distribute the films.
example.arg: big studios to bankroll and distribute the films

roleset.name: move
roleset.note: GET-V NOTES: metaphorical extension of convert-26.6.2. (from get.05-v)

example.name: metaphorical motion
example.text: Financing problems caused a nine-month delay in *trace* getting the product to market.

example.name: destination and source all at once
example.text: [*] Getting to and from the airport in coming weeks may be theproblem, however.

roleset.name: must
roleset.note: GET-V NOTES: (from get.06-v)

example.name: get as must
example.text: We've got to take a serious look at how we're doing our jobs.
example.arg: to take a serious look at how we're doing our jobs

roleset.name: have the pleasure of doing something, "i gettuh..."
roleset.note: GET-V NOTES: Roleset added by Claire based on instances in wsj revisions; existing rolesets seemed inappropriate eithersyntactically or semantically. No VNcls. (from get.22-v)

example.name: All arguments
example.text: `` [The oldest designer]-1 got *-1 to work on the dashboard ,'' she recalls .

roleset.name: auxiliary usage (rel followed by a vp)
roleset.note: GET-V NOTES: No VNcls. Do not tag, except for rel! (from get.24-v)

roles.note: rel is followed by a VP node. (from get.24-v)

example.name: standard
example.text: John and Mary got married.

roleset.name: get to: aggravate, annoy
roleset.note: GET-V NOTES: Added by Julia, Meredith for Google.

example.name: name-v
example.text: My back really gets to me when it rains.

roleset.name: understand, grasp conceptually
roleset.note: GET-V, GET-N NOTES: Added by Julia for AMR.

role.descr: source of understood thing, perhaps another communicator

example.name: get-v
example.text: Oh, I get you now.

example.name: get-v
example.text: I don't get why my second loop isn't pushing values
example.arg: why my second loop isn't pushing values

example.name: get-v
example.note: Here, women are a topic, not a source of topic. They are most definitely not possessions, which is why this is not a good sense to conflate with .01.
example.text: I don't get women.

example.name: get-v
example.text: Yeah that's not what-1 I got *-1 from his comment at all. I think there was a misunderstanding

roleset.name: produce
roleset.note: GET_OUT-V NOTES: No appropriate VNcls or FN. Checked by Julia, 12/2010. (from get.07-v)

example.name: become?
example.text: [The company]-1 is certain *trace*-1 to get out some aircraftwith just supervisors and other non-striking employees on hand.
example.arg: with just supervisors and other non-striking employees on hand.

roleset.name: manage to
roleset.note: GET_AWAY-V NOTES: No appropriate VNcls or FN. Checked by Julia, 12/2010. (from get.08-v)

example.name: manage
example.text: Buyers may not get away with some of the things they've done in the past.
example.arg: with some of the things they've done in the past.

roleset.name: recover
roleset.note: GET_BACK-V NOTES: No VNcls. (from get.09-v)

example.name: no 'source'
example.text: John-1 wants *trace*-1 to get his money back.

roleset.name: return
roleset.note: GET_BACK-V NOTES: No VNcls. (from get.10-v)

example.name: back to normal
example.text: UAL trading would get back to normal.

roleset.name: get even: revenge
roleset.note: GET_BACK-V NOTES: frame added by Arrick. No VNcls. (from get.19-v)

example.name: all args
example.text: Oh please you never wondered how-1 *PRO* to get back at the police for writing you a speeding ticket *T*-1
example.arg: for writing you a speeding ticket.

roleset.name: respond to an inquiry/correspondence
roleset.note: GET_BACK-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on SMS. (from get.25-v)

example.name: args 0, 1
example.text: Hey girl , so for some reason the girl I was supposed to stay with is nt picking up her phone , are you still free to host justin case she does nt get back to me ?

roleset.name: begin
roleset.note: GET_OFF-V NOTES: No VNcls. (from get.11-v)

example.name: almost idiomatic
example.text: A new $46 million steel rod minimill got off to a rocky start in early 1988.
example.arg: A new $46 million steel rod minimill

roleset.name: get away with something
roleset.note: GET_OFF-V NOTES: Roleset based on instances in wsj revisions, comparison to get.08: get away with... Framed by Claire. No VNcls.(from get.23-v)

example.name: Colloquial usage, no arg0
example.text: Where-2 does [Mr. Lehman]-1 get off *PRO*-1 castigating Gen.George Marshall for muscling in on naval prerogatives *T*-2 ?
example.arg: *PRO*-1 castigating Gen. George Marsall for muscling in on naval perogatives

example.name: Less colloquial, same sense
example.text: And her dad was the lawyer who-1 *T*-1 got OJ Simpson off for murder of his ex wife.
example.arg: for murder of his ex wife

roleset.name: reach a state of euphoria (via drugs, sex, or random happy things)
roleset.note: GET_OFF-V NOTES:

example.name: get_off-v
example.text: I get off on '57 Chevies

example.name: get_off-v: with arg0
example.text: I-1 've always been able *PRO*-1 to get him off with my mouth, thankfully.

example.name: get_off-v
example.text: I know Chubbs was getting off on Christmas tree decorating this morning but I got a serious problem regarding "The Tree".

example.name: get_off-v
example.text: It has a lot of metaphysical books and I was getting off on Orthodox spirituality at the time - the Philokalia and the sayings of the Fathers.
example.arg: the Philokalia and the sayings of the Fathers

example.name: get_off-v
example.text: John-1 's thing was *-1 getting off on heroin 15 to 20 times a day.

roleset.name: reach, connect with
roleset.note: GET_THROUGH-V NOTES: No VNcls. (from get.12-v)

example.name: London calling
example.text: Two years ago there was trouble with people getting through on the phone.

example.name: with Arg1
example.text: John couldn't get through to Mary.

roleset.name: persevere
roleset.note: GET_THROUGH-V NOTES: Member of VNcls cope-83-1-1. Updated by Julia, 12/2010. (from get.13-v)

example.name: nobody knows...
example.text: With nothing but a good attitude, John got through the worst the University had to offer.
example.arg: With nothing but a good attitude
the worst the University had to offer.

roleset.name: have good relations
roleset.note: GET_ALONG-V NOTES: Frames edited by Arrick (from get.18-v)

example.text: When the Asian Pacific League for Freedom and Democracy met in Auckland, New Zealand , I got along wonderfully for two days withJohn Ni, who was there in his capacity as Director-General of theMedium and Small Business Administration.
example.arg: When the Asian Pacific League for Freedom and Democracy met in Auckland, New Zealand
with John Ni, who was there in his capacity as Director-General of the Medium and Small Business Administration

roleset.name: cope, manage
roleset.note: GET_BY-V NOTES: Member of VNcls cope-83-1-1. (from get.17-v)

role.descr: what getting by with or without

example.name: bless technology
example.text: "I do n't know [how] I could get by without my mobile phone*T*-9," exclaims *T* Chang.

roleset.name: begin
roleset.note: GET_DOWN-V NOTES: Member of VNcls convert-26.6.2. Updated by Julia, 12/2010. (from get.15-v)

example.name: get down, baby
example.text: John will get down to business next week.

roleset.name: boogie, get in the groove with, possibly dance
roleset.note: GET_DOWN-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on SMS02.

role.descr: entity jamming out, getting down, boogying
to/with what-- inspiration, mood setter, music, stimulus

example.name: both args
example.text: I 'm into hardcore punk , hip - hop and I can get down with some instrumental stuff like Do Make Say Think
example.arg: with some instrumental stuff like Do Make Say Think

roleset.name: get even: revenge
roleset.note: GET_EVEN-V NOTES: No VNcls. (from get.16-v)

example.name: all args
example.text: Partners at other accounting firms say that [the Deloitte firm in the U.K]'-1. is filing the suit [*-1]to get even with the mergedDeloitte-Touche firm for keeping major auditing work in England.
example.arg: for keeping major auditing work in England

roleset.name: meet
roleset.note: GET_TOGETHER-V NOTES: No VNcls. (from get.14-v)

example.name: meet
example.text: Mr. Guber got together with Mr. Peters.

roleset.name: have good relations
roleset.note: GET_ON-V NOTES: Frame added by Jena. (from get.20-v)

example.text: His mother and father did not get on well together.

roleset.name: continue on with something
roleset.note: GET_ON-V NOTES: Frame by Claire (from get.21-v)

example.name: The business of life
example.text: Jerry can get on with the business of building a life for himself.
example.arg: with the business of building a life for himself

roleset.name: arise from slumber
roleset.note: GET_UP-v NOTES: Added by Julia based on SMS02.

example.name: args 1, 2
example.text: Yes coffee !!! Afternoon ? I-1 hate *-1 having to get up at a time on Sunday !
